urls.title: Dual‐isotope isoscapes for predicting the scale of fish movements in lowland rivers
urls.description: Assessments of patterns of animal movements are important for understanding their spatial ecology. Geostatistical models of stable isotope (SI) landscapes (isoscapes) provide a complementary tool to ...

text:
When more is better: a new study uses 2 isotopes to successfully track #fish movement in an English river

#MovementEcology #Isoscape #SIA #Telemetry #TrackingNotSlacking #OpenAccess @EmilyR_Winter @BU_Research @Fishtrack1 @EnvAgencyAnglia @NaturalEngland

urls.title: Newsroom - Road closures due to fire, causing delays on local network
urls.description: Motorist are being advised to allow extra time for journeys due to a number of road closures affected by a large scale fire. Shropshire Fire and Rescue Service have urged nearby residents to keep doors and windows shut. Cooler temperatures overnight will mean the smoke cloud will drop. Highways England will monitor the motorway overnight andclose if necessary with a diversion. In addition, the M54 will be closed eastbound between junctions 7 and 5 tonight (Tues 27 April) and tomorrow (Wed 28 April)between

urls.title: Working with and for nature: creating new habitat at Cotehele quay
urls.description: We’re creating a wildlife rich intertidal habitat in the field below the woodland path by Cotehele Quay.

text: Working in partnership with @EnvAgency & supported by @NaturalEngland work has started to return @nationaltrust farmland back to River Tamar as part of plans to create a intertidal habitat which will be more resilient to challenges posed by climate change. https://t.co/A7L2dZiSTI https://t.co/yyji2wLaWl

Working with partners to clean up polluted rivers for people and wildlife 😎
